citations.narrative:
The refrigerators in both the storage room and the kitchen are in need of cleaning. The door of the unit in the kitchen has
food debris and a film over the handles that cannot be avoided in order to open the unit. Inside the unit, the two
recirculation fans on the ceiling have an accumulation of dust on the plastic grate that covers the fan blades. The
refrigeration unit in the storage room that contains meat, fish and other items for carnivorous species, has a red/brown
buildup on the door where it is opened. The unwashed surfaces and dusty fans need to be cleaned to prevent potential
contamination of animal diets being both stored and prepared with the food items within. Contamination of feed could
potentially affect the health and wellbeing of the animals.
Corrected on the day of inspection

There were clusters of flies noted in enclosures throughout the facility and most notably within the kitchen food
preparation area. Flies were noted circling and landing upon the food prep table, cutting board, knives, and adjacent
walls. The Facility does have an insect control program, but at this time it is not effective enough to control the numerous
flies within the facility. A safe and effective program for the control of insects and other pests shall be established and
maintained.
Correct by November 19, 2024
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
Additional Inspectors:
Ashley Alger, Supervisory Animal Care Specialist n

narrative:
3.131(c) 
   
Sanitation. 
The refrigerators in both the storage room and the kitchen are in need of cleaning. The door of the unit in the kitchen has 
food debris and a film over the handles that cannot be avoided in order to open the unit. Inside the unit, the two 
recirculation fans on the ceiling have an accumulation of dust on the plastic grate that covers the fan blades. The 
refrigeration unit in the storage room that contains meat, fish and other items for carnivorous species, has a red/brown 
buildup on the door where it is opened. The unwashed surfaces and dusty fans need to be cleaned to prevent potential 
contamination of animal diets being both stored and prepared with the food items within. Contamination of feed could 
potentially affect the health and wellbeing of the animals. 
Corrected on the day of inspection 
3.131(d)  Repeat
   
Sanitation. 
There were clusters of flies noted in enclosures throughout the facility and most notably within the kitchen food 
preparation area. Flies were noted circling and landing upon the food prep table, cutting board, knives, and adjacent 
walls. The Facility does have an insect control program, but at this time it is not effective enough to control the numerous 
flies within the facility. A safe and effective program for the control of insects and other pests shall be established and 
maintained. 
Correct by November 19, 2024 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives. 
 
Additional Inspectors: 
Ashley Alger, Supervisory Animal Care Specialist n
